intro: Oplismenus aemulus, commonly known as the common lippia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, narrow leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage is often used in traditional herbal remedies due to its medicinal properties. Oplismenus aemulus is also valued in ornamental gardening for its attractive appearance and resilience.
